full_text: Succeed Insurance requires that any administrative law judge, or ALJ, associated with the matter should be displayed in the Hearing Details section of the Matter screen. This means that I need to add a Claim Contact widget to an existing view. The first step is to navigate to the matter I used in the last demonstration. Here is where to place the ALJ widget, at the bottom of the Hearing Details section. Now I'll type Alt Shift I to view the details of this page. The view I need to edit is the Matter Details detail view. Now I'll close this info page. So in Claim Center Studio, I navigate to the Matter Details DV. I'll add a Claim Contact Input widget. And place it at the bottom of the Hearing Details section. The widget must have a locally unique ID. The widget should be associated with the claim associated with the current matter. The widget should be associated with the claim associated with the current matter. Users should be able to edit the ALJ from this page. To avoid conflicts with existing matters, the ALJ field will not be required. I need a display key for the widget's label. Now I'll add the display key to the widget's label property. The value to be displayed in the widget is the ALJ associated with the matter. The range of possible values from which the ALJ can be chosen is the virtual list of all the adjudicators associated with the claim. The value type must be changed to the adjudicator. And the value type must be changed to adjudicator. Now I'll save my work so that I can test it in the user interface. Here I am logged in as Andy Applegate, and I have already reloaded the PCF files. I navigate to the parties involved page. Here I'll delete the existing administrative law judge. Now I'll navigate to the litigation page. Now I'll navigate to the litigation page. I'll edit the existing matter. There are no adjudicators available to fill the ALJ role. So I will create a new one. When I save the adjudicator. And the matter. The new ALJ is visible. The new ALJ should also appear on the parties involved list. And she does. This concludes the adding a claim contact widget demonstration.

segments.text: Succeed Insurance requires that any administrative law judge, or ALJ, associated with the matter should be displayed in the Hearing Details section of the Matter screen. This means that I need to add a Claim Contact widget to an existing view. The first step is to navigate to the matter I used in the last demonstration.

Here is where to place the ALJ widget, at the bottom of the Hearing Details section. Now I'll type Alt Shift I to view the details of this page. The view I need to edit is the Matter Details detail view. Now I'll close this info page. So in Claim Center Studio, I navigate to the Matter Details DV.
I'll add a Claim Contact Input widget.
And place it at the bottom of the Hearing Details section. The widget must have a locally unique ID.
The widget should be associated with the claim associated with the current matter.
The widget should be associated with the claim associated with the current matter.
Users should be able to edit the ALJ from this page.
To avoid conflicts with existing matters, the ALJ field will not be required.
I need a display key for the widget's label.
Now I'll add the display key to the widget's label property.
The value to be displayed in the widget is the ALJ associated with the matter.
The range of possible values from which the ALJ can be chosen is the virtual list of all the adjudicators associated with the claim.
The value type must be changed to the adjudicator.
And the value type must be changed to adjudicator.
Now I'll save my work so that I can test it in the user interface.
Here I am logged in as Andy Applegate, and I have already reloaded the PCF files.
I navigate to the parties involved page.
Here I'll delete the existing administrative law judge.
Now I'll navigate to the litigation page.
Now I'll navigate to the litigation page.
I'll edit the existing matter.
There are no adjudicators available to fill the ALJ role.
So I will create a new one.
When I save the adjudicator.
And the matter.
The new ALJ is visible.
The new ALJ should also appear on the parties involved list.
And she does.
This concludes the adding a claim contact widget demonstration.
